DCL Project Files

Send comments on this topic.
This section describes the DCL specific files which are placed into the Project Directory when a new project is created.

Summary

dclconf.h   The master DCL project configuration header.
dclproj.c   A container for the DCL project startup and shutdown code, which may be customized by an OEM.
dclproj.mak   The make file which controls the compilation of DCL specific code in the Project Directory.
prjbuild.bat   PRJBUILD is the command which invokes Win32 hosted builds.
prjclean.bat   PRJCLEAN is the command which cleans the build tree.
prjinfo.bat   This batch file contains information about the project.

dclconf.h

The master DCL project configuration header. This header file resides in each DCL Project Directory, and is automatically included by dcl.h.

When a new project is created, a template dclconf.h file is copied from the \dcl\os\wince\newproj directory.

See the section DCL Project Configuration Settings for information on the contents of this file.

Note that the default template header may be different for each the various operating systems which DCL supports, so mixing copies from different operating system abstractions is not recommended.

dclproj.c

A container for the DCL project startup and shutdown code, which may be customized by an OEM.

dclproj.mak

The make file which controls the compilation of DCL specific code in the Project Directory.

Note -- This file is used for Win32 hosted projects, and does not exist for GNU hosted projects.

prjbuild.bat

PRJBUILD is the command which invokes Win32 hosted builds. It takes one optional command line parameter, which must be a number from 0 to 3. This value indicates the debug level to use, with '0' indicating that the build is a release build. If this value is not supplied, the build process will use the value of the B_DEBUG environment variable. If the B_DEBUG environment variable is not set, the debug setting will default to '0'.

Note -- This file is used for Win32 hosted projects, and does not exist for GNU hosted projects.

prjclean.bat

PRJCLEAN is the command which cleans the build tree. It has the following syntax:

prjclean [all | everything]

By default, PRJCLEAN simply iterates over the product directory tree and deletes all files generated during the build. However it does NOT delete the files created in the DEBUG and RELEASE directories for your project (or any other project).

If the "all" option is used, PRJCLEAN will also additionally delete the DEBUG and RELEASE directories for the current project only.

If the "everything" option is used, PRJCLEAN will additionally delete the DEBUG and RELEASE directories for all projects in the product's "projects" directory tree.

Note -- The "all" and "everything" options are case sensitive and must be lowercase.

Note -- This file is used for Win32 hosted projects, and does not exist for GNU hosted projects.

prjinfo.bat

This batch file contains information about the project. It has the general form: 

        REM ---------- Product/Project Settings ----------
        set P_ROOT=c:\dl\dcl
        set P_PROJDIR=c:\dl\dcl\projects\myproj
        set P_OS=wince
        set P_TOOLSET=toolsetname
        set P_TOOLROOT=c:\toolchainroot
        set P_CPUFAMILY=arm
        set P_CPUTYPE=xscale
        set P_PRIVATE=1


        REM --------------- Build Settings ---------------
        REM Define any product-wide C compiler flags to use
        set B_CFLAGS=

Note -- This file is used for Win32 hosted projects, and does not exist for GNU hosted projects.
